meanings.definition: An additional tax imposed on top of the regular tax rate.
meanings.sent1: The supertax on luxury cars made them very expensive.
meanings.sent2: The government introduced a supertax on high-income earners.
meanings.sent3: Paying the supertax felt like adding salt to injury.
meanings.sent4: The supertax was a heavy burden on small businesses.
meanings.sent5: The supertax loomed over the citizens like a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: To levy or impose an additional tax on something.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to supertax imported goods to protect local industries.
meanings.sent2: They chose to supertax cigarettes to discourage smoking.
meanings.sent3: The decision to supertax sugary drinks caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: The proposal to supertax online transactions raised concerns among businesses.
meanings.sent5: The authorities supertaxed the wealthy to fund public services.
